cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 510 mi SSE of Port O'Connor, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Harvey is drifting northwestward and is forecast to accelerate slightly toward the north-northwest, moving toward the middle Texas coast and likely strengthening into a hurricane before landfall.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: middle Texas coast (near Port O’Connor / Corpus Christi, TX)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: North of Port Mansfield TX to San Luis Pass TX; Storm Surge Watch: Port Mansfield TX to High Island TX; Tropical-Storm Watch: Boca de Catan MX to Port Mansfield TX, and North of San Luis Pass TX to High Island TX
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect as of Advisory #14
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Texas coast and portions of southwest Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm–force winds are not expected in northern Indiana; any winds from Harvey’s remnant circulation should remain below gale force.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None (port is inland and far removed from Gulf surge influences).
weather_observation.rainfall: Some remnant moisture from Harvey could reach the Ohio Valley early next week, producing occasional showers, but heavy accumulations are not anticipated.
weather_observation.other_hazards: None expected that would directly affect port operations.
